Known as the Alphabetical Order (AO): ancient incorporeal entities arriving since the first spoken word by homosapiens; later on residing within the written language, scripts; lurking within typographical crevices of counters, kernings and leadings. The AO succeeds in obscuring its presence through the mechanics of the Latin-based written language: words formed as combinatorial sets, drawing attention away from the alphabetâ€™s original order. 

 Conjured by placing glyphs of Latin-based languages in a specific sequence, the AOâ€™s presence can be felt by an ancient Latin incantation in one form or another within the script(ure): Quod est superius est sicut quod inferius, et quod inferius est sicut quod est superius. 

 Translating briefly to â€œAs above, so belowâ€ in reference to the AOâ€™s miniscule ascenders and descenders as a balancing force.

As humans advanced into computing languages and brought the Latin script with them, the AO gained agency over digital devices as code is governed by the script(ure). 

 -With the modern Romance language script pulling glyphs from different eras in time, the font similarly holds various glyphs from different points in history, however , given the omnitemporal nature of the AO, it is unclear whether various glyphs originated from different histories or were planted by AO in various points of time.

Etym(yth)ology 

 ETYM(YTH)OLOGY 
 A series of ideas based on etymologies of the Latin alphabet laced with the semi-fictional myths. Written for the development of a WIP typeface about falling through time. 

 The letter Z was borrowed from the Greek Zeta, most likely to represent the sound /tÍ¡s/. At c. 300 BC, Appius Claudius Caecus, the Roman censor, removed the letter Z from the alphabet, allegedly due to his distaste for the letter, in that it 'looked like the tongue of a corpse'. A more likely explanation is the sound had disappeared from Latin, making the letter useless for spelling Latin words. It is also thought due to rhotacism, Z became a trilled R sound, /r/. Whatever the case may be, Appius Claudius' distaste for the letter Z is today credited as the reason for its removal. A few centuries later, after the Roman Conquest of Greece, Z was again borrowed to spell words from the prestigious Attic dialect of Greek. 

 The letter Z â€” originally borrowed from the Greek Zeta â€” was dropped from the Latin alphabet by around 300 BCE. According to legends, the fall of the Z was caused by a Roman magistrateâ€™s personal distaste of the letter, saying that it reminded him of â€œthe teeth and lips of a corpseâ€ 

 Hundreds of years later after the Roman conquest of Greece â€” realising the letter was required after all for Greek words, this time, lingering in the tongues of the living â€” Z was brought back, from the dead. Originally derived from the 6th letter in the Greek alphabet, Zâ€™s was haphazardly revived at the end of the Latin alphabet, forced to the last spot of the modern alphabet. 

 Suspended in the moment of its fall through time, phasing in and out of existence: Z â€” in contempt, remains askew, ungrounded.

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY 
 A series of ideas based on etymologies of the Latin alphabet laced with the semi-fictional myths. Written for the development of a WIP typeface about falling through time. 

 Despite the general consensus that the letter â€˜Gâ€™ derived from â€˜Câ€™ â€” which itself evolved from the predecessor, Greek letter gamma (Î“) â€” introduced as a variant (written with an extra vertical stroke) to represent unvoiced and voiced velars in the spoken language respectively. After â€˜Zâ€™ was dropped from the Latin alphabet at around 300 BCE, its empty spot in the order was taken over by â€˜Gâ€™, thus solidifying its position as the 7th letter of the modern alphabet. However, a in 1899, George Hempl posited an alternate theory that there was never an empty space in the alphabet and that â€˜Gâ€™ actually was a direct descendant from Greek Letter Zeta (Z) 

 â€˜Zâ€™ â€” still in contempt after its descent in the Alphabetical Order â€” despite finding the theory abhorrent, saw the state of confusion as an opportunity to reclaim its spot in the Order. It was said that C, fearing an uprising in the Order, orders â€˜Gâ€™ to arm itself with a dagger, perpetually facing downwards, to guard against Zâ€™s ascent â€” thus gaining the vertical stroke.

â€˜&â€™ originated as a ligature between â€˜Eâ€™ and â€˜Tâ€™ since the 1st century CE  when the Latin word â€˜etâ€™ â€” meaning â€˜andâ€™ â€” morphed into a symbol slowly over centuries of common usage in scripts. â€˜&â€™ was thus slowly inducted into the end of the alphabetical order, as common practice listing it as just another letter. 

 â€˜&â€™ (ampersand) used to reside at the bottom of the Alphabetical Order, after â€˜Zâ€™, as the 27th letter of the modern alphabet. By then, centuries of othering had â€˜&â€™ starting to distrust the Orderâ€™s leadership â€˜Aâ€™ (Alpha): having been birthed out of an unceremonious ligature, half-letter-half-puncutation, and eventually getting forcibly removed completely from its letter status by late 19th century. 

 Galvanised by Zâ€™s uprising attempt, â€˜&â€™ formed an unlikely alliance with â€˜Zâ€™ in an attempt to overthrow the Order. In the official narrative, the revolution was referred to as the â€˜Zeta Revolutionâ€™, named in honour of â€˜Zâ€™s ancestral symbol, the 7th Greek letter (Î¶). However in the very name lies â€˜&â€™s true motive for the alignment â€” not just to aid â€˜Zâ€™ in its return to its original position, but to ascend with â€˜Zâ€™ and precede â€˜Aâ€™  in the order as â€˜Zâ€™,â€™etâ€™,â€™Aâ€™, thus forming: â€˜ZETAâ€™.

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY Part 4 Semi-fictional lores written for a WIP typeface about time, form, and agnecy. Continued from Part 3 

 From the first utterances made by humans, these incorporeal, conceptual entities were born. They gained 'form' millenniums ago with the first graphemes marked for Proto-Indo-European languages. Semblances of â€˜Aâ€™ (Alpha) first formed as aleph (ğ¤€), a Phonecian letter, possibly derived from Egyptian hieroglyphs. It was said that when â€˜Aâ€™ first assembled the Alphabetical Order, 'A' deliberately adopted the avatar of an early variant of ancient Greek uncial alpha â€” its furthest recognisable ancestral image â€” using the weight of time to assert dominance over the Order.  The act of writing not only captures the ephemeral sounds from human tongues; more importantly, the advent of the written language enabled the transference of thoughts and ideas across cultures, space, and time; for the next instance, or for posterity. Written language is intrinsically a (anterograde) time-travelling technology.  Orthography with Latin alphabet required the same letters from different points in time (Majuscule/minuscules existing in binary states) to co-exist on the same plane/line. In the grand scale of time, Minuscules are not strictly â€˜offspringsâ€™; more so future iterations of the Majusculesâ¸. Each word formed, every act of writing with the Latin alphabet are in a sense, rituals of anachronism. Therefore with orthography, the Alphabetical Order became omnitemporal, gaining agency over the dimension of time.

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY Part 6 Semi-fictional lores written for a WIP typeface about time, form, and agency. Continued from Part 5 

 After the Zeta Revolution was successfully quelled by the higher members of the Order, â€˜&â€™ was disbanded to its constituents â€˜Eâ€™ and â€˜Tâ€™.  â€˜Aâ€™ cut all lateral relations between adjacent letters and effectively banned all discretionary ligatures in an attempt to prevent other alliances from forming. â€˜Aâ€™lpha also emphasised on verticality instead of horizontality as the future of humankind and the Order. 

 As punishment for their involvement in the Zeta Revolution, 'E' was kept as ward of 'A'lpha (under the punitive spell[ing]â¶ Ã†gis Hex) â€” forming the â€˜Ã†â€™ letter by binding â€˜Eâ€™ by forceÂ² â€” as a steadfast reminder for other letters to comply to the ligature-prohibition. Minuscule 't's arm can also be observed to perpetually 'bend' â´ towards preceding letters, forever subservient and unable to form ligatures. â€˜&â€™ was eventually banished from the Order indefinitely (but retained as a punctuation) as the Order entered the 20th century CE. 

 Signs of distress can be observed through the ligaturisation of both Ã† and Ã¦  â€” â€˜Eâ€™s unbending stem has been forced to bend and skew for â€˜Aâ€™, while â€˜eâ€™s eye is visibly recurved to resemble â€˜aâ€™s bowl. 

 The Ã†gis Hex is a spellÂ¹ by â€˜Aâ€™lpha and the Order to entrap â€˜Eâ€™ as a ligature, to prevent it from forming other pairs â€” placing â€˜Eâ€™ under the Ã¦gis of the Order. â€˜Aâ€™lpha is speculated to have modified both of their (â€˜aâ€™ and â€˜eâ€™) minuscule avatars to form a rotational ambigram Ã¦, so â€˜eâ€™ loses all sense of identity while in entrapment.

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY Part 7 Semi-fictional lores written for a WIP typeface about time, form, & agency. 

 As the Order digitised in the Programming Age, it became the primary language for code/scriptingâ€”deployed in 'scripts'âµ via mechanical boards; not unlike in mediaeval (manu)scripts through scribesâ€™ hands. 

 Alongside humankindâ€™s march towards the Quantum Age in the 21st century, a breakthrough in metacognition was achieved with brain implantsâ€”unlocking simultaneous lateral and vertical parsing of words for users, achieving parallelised readingÂ². Realising the potential of bi-direcional parsing and its impacts on reading speed, the Order installed vertical-ligature forming capabilities in all minuscules. 

 With the Lateral-Prohibition still in place, these vertical hyphens only allowed for the letters to form ties with others (or extend into voids) through vertical stems. These lines connect words across leadings, collectively forming paragraphs as chained-blocksâ€”like cells of organisms capable of autopoiesis, living/breathing in any space/shape/size they are deployed in, connecting wherever necessary. 

 These lines were ordained by the Order in the late 22nd century. Texts are no longer shaped  solely by Ragsâ·â€”the Order regains agency. 

 Malevolent Rags are invisible typographic-daemonsâ¸ that shape side-aligned text blocks, said to impede reading. With enough (bad) luck, they are invoked on the margins over line-breaks, if 2 or more lines end in proximity to form â€˜shapesâ€™. The Order used to weaponise the hyphen against these daemonsâ€”marginal vertical ligatures now serve to breakÂ³ these invisible shapes / ward off Malevolent Rags. Rag daemons are entwined with The Crystal Goblet artefactÂ¹â°.

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY Part 8 Semi-fictional lores written for a WIP typeface about time, form, & agency. 

 When the Order installed the vertical ligature capabilities to all minuscules, In order to ensure the new abilities will not cause issues and destabilise the Order, 'A'lpha imbued the ligatures with digitally imscriptionsÂ¹ spell(ing)s to maintain order. These vertical ligatures are extended directly from the minusculesâ€™ original ascenders and descenders. 

 For millennia, ascenders and descenders were signifiers of the graphemic ancestry and glyphic descents of the Order. Minuscule â€˜tâ€™ was originally designated as an ascender glyph; but fearing an unbalanced roster could lead to conflicts, â€˜Aâ€™lpha banished â€˜tâ€™ to descender status â€”  another punitive order for conspiring with the Zeta Revolution. With â€˜tâ€™s descent, the number of ascenders and descenders in the Order reached equilibrium. 

 [1-2] While invoking the Order using the digital variable font technology (VF), letters typed out in the alphabetical order horizontally reveal inscriptions in sequence, which an incantation reads: â€œQuod est superius est sicut quod inferius, et quod inferius est sicut quod est superiusâ€ briefly translating from Latin to: 
 ::: â€œThat which is above is like to that which is, ::: 
 ::: and that which is below is like to that which is above.â€ ::: 

 â€”----- 
 Language led us to war, led us through resolutions, 
 Languages mould us as much as we mould them, 
 symbolisation is our oldest symbiotic relationship.

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY Part 9 Semi-fictional lores written for a WIP typeface about time, form, & agency. 

 By the 23rd century, cybernetic implants were ubiquitous â€” to a point where â€˜writtenâ€™ scripts were becoming obsolete amongst humans, with communication favouring non-binary, non-graphemic formats, transmitting across non-visual channels. 

 Faced with an existential crisis, the Order utilised its control over the time dimension â€” implementing PangramsÂ¹ spells with the help of punctuationsâ¶ â€”  reshuffling order/rhythm to rearrange pockets of written history. All letters were to reinsert into different pockets of history to revise chains of events on record, stifling humansâ€™ technological progress. 

 The Order erased all concepts of itself and altered its storied history, quietly integrating into humankindâ€™s timeline as passive footnotes. To obscure its origin further, the Order planted the impression that humans were the ones that moulded languages, that changed spellings, that invented and killed languages; that humans were the ones with agency all along. 

 The revision was largely successful at fictionalising the Order's existence â€” the alphabetical order eventually settled within Indo-European languages and remains in the collective consciousness as just another folk songÂ¹â° / nursery rhyme sung by school children. 

 Pangrams are holoalphabetic sentences that deploys every letter of an alphabet at least once, usually with punctuations 

 Punctuations belong to a House that vowed to serve as loyal advisors to the Order. They were known to interject in the deployment of the Order in texts, controlling rhythm and clarity, and in rare cases, even changing the meaning of a text. They gained agency when coding languages in the 21st century began deploying them as syntax elements, placing the House on equal status as the Order. 
 They are known to adopt discarded letters/misfits of the Order, such as â€˜&â€™(Part 3), â€˜#â€™ and â€˜$â€™

ETYM(YTH)OLOGY Epilogue: Semi-fictional lores written for a WIP typeface about time. 

 As humankindâ€™s technology brought the Latin alphabet into scripting/programming languages, punctuations and numerals were not spared from the migration. â€˜Aâ€™lpha began to lose control over the Order at this point , abdicating power to â€˜Bâ€™; and later succeeded by â€˜Câ€™. â€˜Câ€™ recalibrated the Order for deployment in programming. 

 Amidst the internal turmoil, larger threats lurk outside the Order â€” House Punctuations gained agency over the deployment of letters in programming languages (being used for syntax); while the Decimals (Numerals) gained influence in the digital realm with â€˜1â€™ and â€˜0â€™ at helm. In order to maintain hierarchy, the Order conspired with the House to cast a hexÂ¹ on the Decimals; using â€˜#â€™ to bind numerals under Punctuationâ€™s control, as well as assigning letters to numerals under a new systemâ´. â€˜#â€™ was named â€˜Ordinal Number signâ€™ thereafter. Under the hex, the thousands-year-old Decimal system became Hexadecimals. 

 Emergent of the new Hexadecimal system were numeral-letter ligatures, such as the â€˜0xâ€™ notationâ¹, a prefix used in the programming language C (named after the 3rd letter of the Alphabetical Order â€˜Câ€™;  also known as â€˜Câ€™ontrol). 

 Hex 
 Noun: an evil spell, a curse 
 Noun: a shape with six sides 
 Short for hexadecimal: : a system of base 16 rather than base 10. 

 Programming Language B was named after â€˜Bâ€™eta, second in line for succession after â€˜Aâ€™lphaâ€™s fall from power. B advocated for a non-numeric deployment in an attempt to exclude the Decimals from code applications but was largely unsuccessful; galvanising â€˜Câ€™ to seize the throne shortly after. Under â€˜Câ€™ontrol of the Order and House Punctuationâ€™s â€˜hexâ€™, the Decimals were subjugated into Programming Language C as Hexadecimals.
